If you're looking for the OG FPS experience, look no further.

Now I've given this game a few hours of my time. From what I've heard from like everybody, it's an amazing game. 

Soooo many things frustrated me with this game. First off, I can't stand low rez 3D, it gives me headaches and makes me want to puke (literally, not figuratively). It's like GTA vice city, the game is so good but it looks so shit that I can't play it. Old 2D games are fine for me, but 3D, no thank you. 
Also, you die all the time in this game for stuff out of your control, like a freaking pipe falling on my head! How was I supposed to know that? Medium powers? 
Shooting is not very accurate, like not at all! 

That's about it, didn't finish the game. So yeah, there you go!

After hours of long dedication, staying up on sleepless nights, and almost breaking my computer, I have completed the best single player game ever in my opinion. Please note, I have not played any other Half-Life games. Fantastic challenges, good storyline, and intense strategy. Thank you, Valve. 10/10

Half-life a genre defining game that is praised as being the second coming of christ, and it kinda was...
I get that it's old and that it can't be perfect in all aspects. Start off with saying gameplay was just immensly fun enjoyed every encounter with an enemy. Big ol'e variety in weapons, great controls and was hard but fair. Unfortunalty the story did not get the same treatment it was well not even there, the audio was uncomprehendible you didnt know why you were doing something when you were doing something you just ran around clicking things and killing things. Great game to play for fun, but just to dang hard to follow for story.

Pros:
- Solid gameplay
- Fast action
- Great level variety 
- Tough game
Cons:
- Story was incomprehindible 
- Voice acting fuzzy (It's old I know)
- Never know what your'e doing 

Final Score: 8/10
PS. Shouldnt have to go out of my way to learn the story

I am wimp.

Run around corner. See solider with shotgun. Get shot. Die
Retry. Kill soldier. Feel successful. Run around corner into hall. Two vortiguants spawn. I shoot one. One shoots me. I die. Dang. Run back. Forget about soldier. Get shot by him. Die.
Run back, kill soldier. Throw grenade around corner. It doesn't bounce. Explodes. I die. Dang.
Run back. Kill soldier. Shoot vortiguants. Run through corridor. Headcrab jumps at me. I survive. Hit headcrab with crowbar twenty times. It dies. I feel like there's hope I'll win. Find health. Eat health. Get health. Soldier shoots me. Lose health. Die.
Grit teeth, let out a battle cry (Softly so I don't annoy anyone) And run forward. Forgot to save. Soldier with shotgun kills me. Dang.


10/10 Would headcrab again.

Gli anni passano ma questo titolo rimane sempre uno dei migliori sparatutto e uno dei migliori giochi per PC in assoluto. Non amo alla follia gli sparatutto, per piacermi devono avere ore di gioco, difficoltà media e una trama che ti prende, raccontata in modo originale e con temi fantascientifici o comunque molto seri. Questo titolo ha tutto quello che serve per piacere a me personalmente ma obiettivamente il gameplay immediato e semplice e la storia raccontata tramite gli NPC che incontreremo nel gioco e ancora il level design impeccabile con qualche accenno di buona colonna sonora qua e la rendono questo gioco un must. Fantastico, se siete appassionati non può mancare nella vostra playlist!

Nem sok tagadni valóm van.
Most játszottam végig életemben először a Half Life első részét.
Megkésve bár, de törve .... nem?

A második része és annak fejezetei valami zseniálisra sikerültek.
Többször is végigjátszottam mindegyiket.
Kivéve ezt.
Ez valahogy mindig csak tolódott, és kicsúszott a látóteremből.
De ami késik, el is múlik.

Grafikáról nincs mit írnom, ezt akkor kellett volna megtennem, amikor a játék maga megjelent,
hiszen akkor volt nagy durranás, akkor volt átütő erejű.

A játékmenet az elején lassan indul, de aztán hamar a katasztrófa közepében találjuk magunkat,
hála Mr. Freeman és az egész Black Mesa-bagázs hozzá(NEM)értő munkásságának.
Folyamatosan játszottam vele 3 napon keresztül.
A történetben valahogy ellavíroztam, tettem a dolgomat, aztán 3 nap játszás után meguntam…

Több mint fél év után folytattam, mint kiderült körülbelül a játék felénél hagytam abba.
A vége felé viszont már nem tudtam abba hagyni.
Persze azért sem, mert már szenvedtem és 'csakazértis' be akartam már fejezni.
Így néha egy-egy részen csak simán átugráltam, nem öltem meg minden ellenfelet.

Aztán az outro végén számomra kiderült, a történetből sz*rt sem értettem :D

I never played this when it first came out.  So of course it looks dated compared to modern games.  There is nothing wrong with older games, many I still play now.  Overall, I say this is a fairly good game.  This game is a bit of a mixed bag.  Being a FPS game, I enjoyed most of it.  Not being a big fan of puzzle or jumping games, there are parts I did not enjoy that much.  The puzzle aspects, while really simple, just seemed to slow the pace of the game for me. I'd rather be shooting something  than sliding crates around to get to the next goal. Some people, on the other hand, will greatly enjoy this aspect.  The parts of the game that require jumping I found to be boring and tedious.  Mr. Freeman seemed to be on uppers all the time, running too fast and over shooting most of the jumps repeatedly.  The controls on this aspect just did not seem as precise as I would have liked. Again, others will find jumping to be fun.  There are some games I go back to over and over again because they have great replay value... this is not one of them for me.  Once was enough.   7 out of 10 for me and my picky tastes.  Probably higher for those that like the mixed bag aspect.

Fantastic game that set the foundation for FPS as a genre. Even playing this game almost 20 years after release, it is refreshing, smooth, and enjoyable. I would highly recommend this to anyone who plays modern FPS games. It is not a long game, though it is still very immersive and interesting.

 Accurate theoretical-physicist simulation software, Half-Life is not.

10/10

The first time I came in contact with Half-Life was around 1999, I used to watch my brother play this game, to say the least I was amazed by the graphics and HL world back then. Some time later I started to play the game myself, as a real noob, I was pretty bad at it, occasionally playing multiplayer with my brother and friends, I was usually the worst of them (having the worst score). 
As time passed and I started to play CS 1.6, then HL2 and CSS, gradually getting better and better at every aspect of the game. Becoming a CSS regular, I became familiar with CS mods (DR, MG, ZM, BHOP...), having a few thousand hours in CSS.

Today, replaying the first Half-Life I came to realize how much of an impact this game had on the whole series, inspiring most of the mods known to todays Counter-Strike community.

Beside a very interesting story line, it has a diverse world, completely voiced dialog, awesome weapons and monsters and a legendary status in my book.

no less than a 10/10

Great game. I have no problem with old graphics or games but it seems to be a bit too dated for me to play, will probably pick up Black Mesa instead.
Hooks you on the plot, world is immersive, weapons and world design unique. Very original and innovative for its day and age. However some of the levels appear to be broken, one specific area took me  at least 2 hours to beat because one of the in-game trams got stuck. Not unbeatable though without a walkthrough or some ingenuity.
A problem is the game is so old it breaks when I close it so until I restart my computer steam acts as if It's still open, thus my 7 hours of gameplay is now 125+ hours, and preventing me from playing other steam games until I restart my system.
Overall a good game. I recommend you grab the valve complete pack or the orange box instead of this on it's own though.
9/10.
